page.title: 17Lydiard Millicent School
page.content: The original school was built in{1840 and the tiny 7m by 5m room which is now the library contained up to 40 children . When in{1880}the extension to the red brick building which now forms the classroom for the top class was contructed,subscribers included the Rev.Henry Hayward(Â£40) , Lord Shaftesbury (4 guineas) and local landowner James Sadler (5 guineas). The{ghost of Miss Shaw}the headmistress of 1880 is reputed to haunt the old rooms ! Now 4 full time teachers educate{113 {pupils}in 5 classrooms . The school has a large playground and sports field where{athletics}and training for the successful{netball and football teams takes place . The children think that their own hall would be useful as at the moment they have to use the parish hall "down the lane".
